epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives, placed on building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation exceeding 0.1% by weight.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight (quarries) or m3 of concrete (batching plant); economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All data updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

transport.average_transport_distance: 14.52 km from manufacturing gate to site

installation.operational_control: Holcim has no operational control over installation
installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from ready-mix truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities such as site work and forms

deconstruction.process: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate; assumptions based on common scenarios and National Waste Report 2022

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process where concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere through chemical reaction; reduces net CO2 emissions over lifetime
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

carbon_emission_context.sustainability_commitment: Holcim's 2050 net-zero targets endorsed by Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.database_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Waste concrete processed into recycled aggregate replacing virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

primary: Global warming potential (GWP-Total, GWP-Fossil, GWP-Biogenic, GWP-Luluc)
Abiotic depletion potential (elements and fossil fuels)
resource_use: Use of renewable primary energy excluding raw materials
Total use of renewable primary energy
additional_indicators: Global warming potential excluding biogenic uptake
Green Star indicators (Human Toxicity, Land use, Ionising radiation, Particulate Matter, Water Scarcity Index)

disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks.
Some impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience.
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal effects.
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR documents (2024)
Scientific publications on carbon footprint of Australia's construction sector
